Thus, the Three Caverns are expounded. The Dao Lords proclaim and transmit them, bestowing upon the worthy to be delivered, opening and receiving across kalpas. You now ask about the previously mentioned responsive generations—listen carefully to my words, and I shall reveal to you the precious instructions.

The Primordial Beginning opens and transforms, universally pervading heaven and humanity. The body generates marks of excellence; realms universally receive and endow. The formless responds to the embodied; through images, words are established. Through cultivation arising from the conditioned, one then ascends to emptiness and quiescence. The Three Caverns provide guidance; the nine grades descend in gradation. The wondrous extremity of the Dao’s source darkly communicates with the Mysterious One. The body resolves the profound and vast; understanding illuminates the subtle and wise. The wondrous gates of the Three Pures condescend to perceive these responses."

The Lord of Tranquility addressed the Yellow Thearch: "Formerly, I received from the Great Thearch that in the primordial kalpa of the past, when the Dragon Han revealed the chart, within the inner vastness of primordial chaos, the Ten Titles manifested bodies, entrusting traces to the various heavens, establishing the various Dharmas, and discoursing the Dao beyond words.

The Heavenly Barrier generated the Heavenly Juice, the Heavenly Worthy within the heavens. The formless transformed and generated within the Bright Rosy Clouds Observatory of the Great Luo Heaven, expounding the Three Caverns and thirty-six sections, descending to generate the Three Realms and thirty-six heavens. The Dharma Gates of the Three Caverns are the root and beginning of the myriad practices. Below, they generate the Three Realms, where the forms of beings and things flow forth. From the eight directions downward, each generates five myriad, five thousand, five hundred, and fifty-five myriad, and so on—limitless Three Realms and *Bi-Di* heavens. In the eight directions, each possesses three thousand great thousandfold worlds.

The limitless Three Realms all receive from the Three Pures. The Three Origins above and below comprise thirty-six heavens. Each heaven has four directions, and four nines array the ranks, above corresponding to the thirty-six gates of the Heavenly Armillary Sphere, universally forming the thirty-six tones of the *Bi-Di* realms. Within a single mote of dust are thirty-six qi. Heavenly beings and humans mutually perceive and together receive the Dao to generate life.

The thirty-six earths universally perceive and respond to the images. The Three Caverns interpenetrate and transform; the ordinary and sagely differ. Responses follow the mechanisms, and there are further nine kinds: the Upper and Lower Sagely Teachings, which above communicate with the Jade Pure; the Middle-Upper Perfected Teachings, which next communicate with the Highest Pure; the Lower-Upper Immortal Teachings, which next communicate with the Grand Pure; the Upper-Middle Sagely Teachings, which next communicate with the Formless; the Middle-Middle Perfected Teachings, which next communicate with the Heaven of Form; the Lower-Middle Immortal Teachings, which next communicate with the Realm of Desire; the Upper-Lower Sagely Teachings, which below connect with the keen-rooted; the Middle-Lower Perfected Teachings, which below connect with the average-rooted; and the Lower-Lower Immortal Teachings, which below connect with the dull-rooted.

The Three Vehicles proceed gradually or suddenly; the three roots differ. The heavenly beings and humans of the Three Realms are guided by the Three Treasures. The sagely teachings of the Three Pures are the mysterious steps of the Three Caverns. The Divine Homeland of the Thearchs is vast in principle and empty and silent, universally generating the wondrous existence of the various heavens as good ladders. The nature of the Dao is empty and congealed, neither arising nor ceasing, neither coming nor going. It reveals the gates of the multitude of wonders, appearing and disappearing in the indistinct, demonstrating the true and real Dharma.

The various heavens receive bliss. From arising and cultivation, through karmic conditions and actions, from root to fruition and beginning, certifying fruition and transcending—all proceed from these six gates."

The heart holds compassion, mercy, kindness, and forbearance—all four equal perfections. In yielding gentleness and earnest faith, it admonishes and pacifies, ceasing contention. It delights in virtuous conduct and relinquishes the mind of non-virtue. With each thought expanding and broadening, blessings, virtue, and wisdom flourish. The celestial eye perceives clearly, discerning the absence of conceptual thought. Once thought is gone, form and shape also vanish. Abandoning discriminative consciousness and deepening cultivation, there is no weariness or exertion. Without movement or action, even the lightest dust is forgotten. Transcending worldly arising and ceasing, one reaches the realm of the Four Sages. Lifespan and blessings span vast kalpas without obstruction. Manifesting transformation bodies, one descends to save the ordinary. Accumulating merit and ascending step by step, one rises through the mysteries to certify fruition.

Further ascending to the Four Brahma Heavens, one gradually ascends to the Grand Clarity. Entering the Nine Immortals, one next ascends to the Highest Clarity. Entering the Nine Perfected, one next ascends to the Jade Clarity. Ascending to the Nine Sages, one reaches the highest sagehood, the supreme-most fruition. Merit and virtue become full, ascending the Dao to enter the formless. Forgetting merit and forgetting fruition, the natural true nature merges with the Dao, obscurely uniting with the Heavenly Worthy of Empty Silence. The entire body eternally abides in profound stillness.

Ning Jun declared: The Three Caverns open and transform, universally planting the seeds for heavenly beings and humans. All officials and retainers receive and uphold them. The Lord of Living Beings exists without form yet is eternally present. The responsive bodies of the realm all become Heavenly Thearchs, universally serving as the Thirty-Six Heavenly Worthies of the upper and lower realms.

Moreover, in this realm, there are thirty-six sounds governing the heavenly worlds, encompassing thirty-six thearchs. From the lower forms to the upper earthly regions, they universally oversee thirty-six qi of thirty-six divisions, universally delivering the boundless Thirty-Six Heavens, ascending through graded ranks.

The sagely hosts of the Three Pures abide in wondrous stillness and constancy. The Three Realms and Nine Lands revolve through the four seasons with swift appropriateness.

When the kalpas of the Three Realms are destroyed, all returns to primordial chaos without arising. The Three Pures and Three Treasures descend primordial qi anew. With each kalpa’s reconstruction, the Three Qi serve as the foundation, and the Three Treasures universally generate life. The nine revolutions are not uniform.

Thus, at the summit of the Formless Realm, the Upper Primordial Heaven’s qi converges for 3,300 degrees, forming the Lesser Yang Nine and Lesser Hundred Six. When its qi converges for 6,600 degrees, it forms the Middle Yang Nine and Middle Hundred Six. When its qi converges for 9,900 degrees, it forms the Greater Yang Nine and Greater Hundred Six. The lower realms of form and desire differ from the upper, with the lower being shorter and the upper longer, their years and months distinct.

At the summit of the Formless Realm above, qi converges for 3,300 degrees. Below it, at the summit of the Middle Primordial Heaven of the Form Realm, qi converges for 6,600 degrees. Further below, at the summit of the Lower Primordial Heaven of the Desire Realm, qi converges for 9,900 degrees. Above lies the Lesser Yang Nine of the Formless Realm; in the middle, the Middle Yang Nine of the Form Realm; below, the Greater Yang Nine of the Desire Realm.

In the Desire Realm below, ten thousand kalpas reduce all to dust. In the Form Realm, a hundred kalpas bring destruction. In the Formless Realm above, one kalpa brings universal dissolution.

Moreover, within the Desire Realm, the nine lands differ. When heaven and earth converge for 3,300 degrees, three lands suffer decline—water, fire, warfare, disease, famine, and starvation cause death. When they converge for 6,600 degrees, six lands suffer harm. When they converge for 9,900 degrees, all nine lands are damaged.

Thus, the Great One distributes qi in circulation. The qi of the Grand Year Palace shifts and adapts, pervading households and nations, extending even to the human body. Wherever it reaches, illness follows the spirit. Three periods—adverse and favorable—intertwine with the eight directions. After thirty-six years, twelve cycles complete, forming a minor convergence. Accumulating numbers brings calamity. Reciting this scripture averts such misfortune.

At the convergence of great and small kalpas, when the nine qi reach their end, karmic retribution is uncertain, and rewards differ above and below.

chunks.original_text: 上清太上开天龙蹻经卷之二 三洞通生元置品第二 是时黄帝拜参宁君，请问三洞尊经三品传道，启问说已，又拜稽首，复请诀曰：三洞尊经上生三境三十六天，三十六部既生，境界各有三十六天，三十六天亦是三十六部以不？ 宁君答曰：玄元始气，三境玄根，三十六部，生天法宅，三洞降德为天人之生主，九圣通化为象帝之玄根，三十六部为境界之生门，三十六天为入道之阶品。 故因经以开导，明气象以通於经，开径路以证道乡，藉证修而登圣果，浄身神以通道境，修盟约以祛惑情。 三十六部洞观齐临，三十六天随心向应，三清上境，下界应缘，三界升坠，劬在心首，阶品不等，故立界名，随根应感，凡有五种，谛听吾言，方为汝说。 宁君告黄帝曰：吾昔承道主，生化法王，天中之尊，皆悉禀受。 初降妙一，圣化初始，始生於元，元通真道，元生於玄，玄主仙教。 仙真圣位，三洞玄尊，三宝立位，三号亦别。 故於龙汉初时，元始开图，应为玉清天宝圣君，号为大洞无形天尊，而说大洞十二部经，而教玉清十二圣天。 次於赤明劫时，应为上清灵宝真君，号为洞玄无名天尊，而说洞玄十二部经，而教上清十二真天。 次於上皇劫时，应为泰清神宝仙君，号曰洞神元始天尊，而说洞神十二部经，而教泰清十二仙天。 三十六部经生於诸天，天人察受，故名三界。 三乘渐顿，接引通方，开度有贤，应身降受，历代教化，天尊通神三洞宝经，随方显用。 宁君告黄帝曰：元始应身，七十二相，上生三境，下生三界，皆禀三洞，品物流形，生天元始，故称天尊。 三十六部天尊，化体三界之内，三宝接生，应感不同，故为元色、色、欲界也。 又为众生根性参差，虽同一天，咸有五种。 一者三洞三界，二者应化三界，三者反出三界，四者流来三界，五者轮回三界。 古旦二洞三界者，三十六部，上生三境三十六天，中生三界三十六帝，下生九垒三十六土皇，天人相通，三乘接引，精气相贯，皆禀三洞，善贷得生也。 其二应化三界者，三部八景，应为阴阳，四时变化，见有生老。 其三反出三界者，至道妙气，灌养生神，虽居耽着，不为所染，起群绝俗，离有为门，反此嚣尘，独超上道也。 其四流来三界者，从道妙本，寄备阴阳，形染六情，见起通执，善善相继，恶恶相续，流转见报，入善恶门也。 其五轮回三界者，耽染见着，而坠三涂，流轮恶道，不能得出，永沈苦海，长沦爱欲也。 宁君告黄帝曰：元始应演三洞尊经，通成境界，接引阶品，无有为有，开化天人，令登元相，以入空解，上显三境，三洞通方，下生三界，应感三种，一者豁尔虚空，二者质碍形色，三者缘虑心体。 言一者豁尔虚空者，空洞道气，混化太虚，应象立无，而成境界，山河石壁，崄岨幽深，端正好丑，以为耽滞，天人六道，感有见元，故云一者豁尔虚空也。 言质碍形色者，应化三界三十二天，生处阴阳，而成有体，从道妙一，善贷生津，寄托胞胎，世间父母，两半相合，而执有形，具足诸根，是为色聚； 既根成就，生六种识，而起分别，是为识聚； 既妄聚尘，分别假相，而生恋着，是为想聚； 倒想聚已，妄生憎爱，而起贪嗔，是为行聚；

*Highest Clarity Scripture of the Supreme Lord on the Dragon’s Ascent to Open the Heavens, Scroll Two*
*Chapter Two: The Three Caverns’ Unification of Life and the Establishment of the Origin*

At this time, the Yellow Thearch bowed and attended upon Lord Ning, inquiring about the transmission of the Three Caverns’ sacred scriptures and their three ranks. Having posed his question, he bowed again, touched his forehead to the ground, and further sought instruction, saying: “The Three Caverns’ sacred scriptures give rise above to the Three Realms and the thirty-six heavens. Once the thirty-six divisions are born, each realm possesses its own thirty-six heavens—are these thirty-six heavens also the thirty-six divisions?”

Lord Ning replied: “The primal qi of the Mysterious Origin, the profound root of the Three Realms, and the thirty-six divisions establish the celestial abodes as their dharma-seats. The Three Caverns bestow virtue as the life-giving lords of heaven and humanity; the Nine Sages’ interconnected transformations serve as the mysterious root of the Image Emperors. The thirty-six divisions are the life-gate of the realms, and the thirty-six heavens are the graded steps to enter the Dao.

Thus, through the scriptures, one is guided; through the illumination of qi and images, one connects with the scriptures. Paths are opened to verify the Dao’s homeland; through verification and cultivation, one ascends to the fruit of sageliness. The body and spirit are purified to commune with the Dao’s realms; covenants are cultivated to dispel deluded passions.

The thirty-six divisions’ cave-visions descend in unison; the thirty-six heavens respond according to the heart’s orientation. The Three Clarities’ upper realms and the lower worlds correspond through karmic conditions. Ascents and descents within the Three Realms depend upon the heart’s intent. As the graded steps are unequal, realm-names are established. According to root and response, there are five kinds in all. Listen carefully to my words, and I shall explain them to you.”

Lord Ning addressed the Yellow Thearch, saying: “In the past, I received the transmission from the Dao’s Lord, the Dharma-King of Life and Transformation, the Most Honored in the Heavens, and all were bestowed upon me.

At the initial descent of the Wondrous One, the sagely transformation began. It arose from the Origin, and the Origin connects with the true Dao. The Origin arises from the Mysterious, and the Mysterious presides over the teachings of immortality. The perfected immortals and sagely ranks, the Three Caverns’ profound honored ones, establish the Three Treasures’ positions, and the Three Titles also differ.

Thus, at the beginning of the Dragon Han kalpa, the Origin opened the chart and manifested as the Heavenly Treasure Sagely Lord of the Jade Clarity, titled the Great Cavern’s Formless Heavenly Worthy. He expounded the *Twelve Divisions of the Great Cavern Scripture* and instructed the twelve sagely heavens of the Jade Clarity.

Next, during the Crimson Brightness kalpa, he manifested as the Numinous Treasure Perfected Lord of the Upper Clarity, titled the Cavern-Mysterious Nameless Heavenly Worthy. He expounded the *Twelve Divisions of the Cavern-Mysterious Scripture* and instructed the twelve perfected heavens of the Upper Clarity.

Next, during the Supreme Sovereign kalpa, he manifested as the Divine Treasure Immortal Lord of the Grand Clarity, titled the Cavern-Spirit Origin’s Heavenly Worthy. He expounded the *Twelve Divisions of the Cavern-Spirit Scripture* and instructed the twelve immortal heavens of the Grand Clarity.

The thirty-six divisions of scriptures arose among the various heavens, and the heaven-dwellers examined and received them, thus naming the Three Realms. The Three Vehicles’ gradual and sudden teachings universally guide and ferry across; they open and deliver the worthy. Manifesting bodies in response, they descend to receive and transmit teachings through the ages. The Heavenly Worthies’ divine Three Caverns’ treasure scriptures display their functions according to the directions.

Lord Ning addressed the Yellow Thearch, saying: “The Origin’s manifested bodies, possessing seventy-two marks, give rise above to the Three Realms and below to the Three Worlds, all receiving the Three Caverns. The ranks of beings flow into form, born from the heaven’s Origin—hence the title ‘Heavenly Worthy.’

The thirty-six divisions of Heavenly Worthies transform within the Three Worlds; the Three Treasures receive and give life, responding to differing karmic conditions. Thus, they become the Formless Realm, the Form Realm, and the Desire Realm. Moreover, as the roots and natures of sentient beings vary, even within a single heaven, there are five kinds.

The first is the Three Caverns’ Three Realms; the second is the Responsive Transformation’s Three Realms; the third is the Reversed Departure from the Three Realms; the fourth is the Flowing Arrival into the Three Realms; the fifth is the Cyclic Rebirth within the Three Realms.

The first, the Three Caverns’ Three Realms: the thirty-six divisions give rise above to the Three Realms’ thirty-six heavens, in the middle to the Three Worlds’ thirty-six emperors, and below to the nine ramparts’ thirty-six earthly sovereigns. Heaven-dwellers and humans interconnect; the Three Vehicles ferry across. Essence and qi interpenetrate, all receiving the Three Caverns. Those who cultivate goodness obtain birth.

The second, the Responsive Transformation’s Three Realms: the three divisions’ eight luminaries respond as yin and yang, transforming through the four seasons. One sees birth, aging, illness, and death.

The third, the Reversed Departure from the Three Realms: the wondrous qi of the utmost Dao nourishes and nurtures the life-spirit. Though dwelling in attachment, one is not defiled by it. Rising above the crowd and transcending the mundane, one departs from the gate of conditioned existence, reverses this clamorous dust, and alone transcends to the supreme Dao.

The fourth, the Flowing Arrival into the Three Realms: from the Dao’s wondrous origin, one temporarily resides in yin and yang. The form is defiled by the six passions; one sees arising and clings to attachments. Good follows good, and evil follows evil, flowing and turning to receive retribution, entering the gates of good and evil.

The fifth, the Cyclic Rebirth within the Three Realms: one is deeply attached and defiled, falling into the Three Wretched Realms, flowing and turning in evil destinies, unable to escape. Forever sinking in the sea of suffering, eternally drowning in craving and desire.”

Lord Ning addressed the Yellow Thearch, saying: “The Origin manifested and expounded the Three Caverns’ sacred scriptures, unifying and completing the realms, guiding and ferrying across the graded steps. From non-being, being arises; the heaven-dwellers are transformed and enlightened, enabling them to ascend to the origin’s appearance, enter emptiness and liberation, and above, reveal the Three Realms. The Three Caverns universally connect; below, they give rise to the Three Worlds, responding to three kinds of karmic conditions: first, the vast and empty void; second, the obstructive form and color; third, the conditioned mind and its essence.

The first, the vast and empty void: the Dao’s qi pervades the Great Void, responding to images and establishing non-being, thus forming the realms. Mountains, rivers, and stone walls, perilous and secluded places, upright and beautiful or crooked and ugly—all become attachments. The six destinies of heaven-dwellers and humans perceive and respond to the origin, hence called the first, the vast and empty void.

The second, the obstructive form and color: the responsive transformation of the Three Worlds’ thirty-two heavens, born in yin and yang, forms corporeal existence. From the Dao’s wondrous One, the good obtain life’s essence, temporarily lodging in the womb. In the world, father and mother unite their halves, grasping at form. The sense faculties are complete—this is the aggregate of form.

Once the faculties are established, the six kinds of consciousness arise, giving rise to discrimination—this is the aggregate of consciousness. Having falsely aggregated dust, one discriminates illusory appearances, generating attachment—this is the aggregate of perception. After the inversion of perception, false love and hate arise, giving rise to greed and anger—this is the aggregate of volition.”

Having beheld the aggregates’ convergence, deluded thoughts solidify, clinging views and ignorance arise, giving birth to evil deeds. Sinking into the Three Wretched Realms, one cannot escape—this is what is called the obstructive form and color.

As for the conditioned and contemplative essence of the mind: this essence is itself karmic retribution, born from karmic conditions. Those of wise virtue return to the Dao and revert to the Source, while the ignorant, defiled, and debased drift and wander through evil destinies. According to the retribution they incur, they perceive the six desires and the four minds, which serve as the boundaries of their realm—this is what is called the conditioned and contemplative essence of the mind.

Thus, the differentiations of karmic response within the Three Realms yield distinct retributions, of which there are five kinds:

First, the state prior to entering the bonds of the Three Realms: though born within their domain, it is not a cause of the Three Realms. Transcending birth and extinction, one ascends to the Four Deva Heavens of Humanity.

Second, the karma that begets birth in the formless realm: transcending form and desire, one relinquishes the four subtle dusts of the senses, intensively cultivating delusive form to purify the spirit.

Third, the karma that begets birth in the form realm: due to the profound weight of form, one gradually relinquishes the six dusts and three measures, and further relinquishes the eighteen heavens’ retribution.

Fourth, the karma that begets birth in the desire realm: the six desires lead to infatuation, thus incurring the six heavens’ retribution.

Fifth, the karma that begets birth in the Three Evil Destinies: due to infatuation with the six desires, the three poisons arise, causing one to fall into the destinies of beasts, hungry ghosts, and hell.

*Upper Clarity Scripture of the Most High on the Opening of Heaven and the Dragon’s Ascent, Scroll Two: Chapter Three, "The Office of Universal Generation"*

chunks.original_text: 宁君告黄帝曰：元始天尊昔於大罗明霞观中，应生境界，而演三洞三十六部。 大洞上品十二部经，具有三洞三十六部尊经之福，何以故？ 大洞圣教通真生仙，兼包众经一切官属，故有洞玄、洞神，三十六部上品功德。 洞玄部中不及兼上，唯通於下，而摄洞神，故有二十四部真仙之力。 洞神仙经不及於上，唯有洞神十二部经生仙之福。 三洞应化，通起生源，三宝接引，粗妙有别。 从道妙气，降迹生神，无有为有，有无所有，体解大道，发无上心，解脱无为，常乐我诤也。 洞玄真教，中乘应缘，从圣降真，通玄入妙，故说应化，开方便门，知有不有，从有发修，无爱染心，离有为境，修习正观，安住中道。 洞神仙教，寄备因绿，故立境界诸天官属，开化人神，成立诸法。 三宝通化，仙为生门，从生发修，入无相体。 故显应化，仙阳生首，从生迁仙，迁仙入真，迁真入圣，迁圣入道。 三洞妙有，以气为宗，宗生於始，始生於元，元生於玄。 始气通圣，上生玉清； 元气主真，中生上清； 玄主仙教，下生泰清。 三清应象，三宝通临，三十六部，应天教授，三十六天，三洞生根，三界禀气，应界修品，七十二相，境界垂形，八十一好，表生大有。 故於龙汉劫时，号为无形天尊，应为玉清天宝圣君，以为大洞之尊玉帝，而生九万九千九百九十亿万气，一气各生九万九千九百九十亿万里，一气各生九万九千九百九十亿万岁，岁里数终，历分相合，下通三界，以为大劫也。 次於赤明劫时，号为无名天尊，应为上清灵宝真君，为洞玄之尊君，而生九万九千九百九十九万气，一气各生九万九千九百九十里，一气各生九万九千九百九十万岁，岁里数终，历分相合，下通三界，以为中劫。 次於上皇劫时，号为元始天尊，为洞神之尊神，而生九万九千九百九十万气，一气各生九万九千九百九十万里，一气各生九万九千九百九十万岁，岁里数终，历分相合，下通三界，以为小劫。 天尊言：吾今应相，境界通身，上显诸天，下应万象，历劫应化，开度兆人。 有道上贤，降为师授，或生下界，与物混冥，托质通凡，沈浮莫辨，与道通化，应接有缘，为受是经，令开慧解，潜行救度，不恃有恩，志净神清，为宣是法。 宁君重告黄帝曰：三清九帝，八景通方，应生三境，通为接引，下降三界，品物成形，开心天人，同禀官属。 故玄元始气，各生八景而为二十四帝，九天各生八景而为七十二官。 言二十四帝化为二十四神，二十四神化为二十四气，气亦成神，神亦成气，散之为云雾，合之为形影，出之为造化，入之为真一，上结三元，言结万物。 神真变化，无有定名，百神之中，皆以三合成德。 天地之极，上境二十四帝，下为三界二十四气。 二十四帝，帝各三元，元各五神，合生三百六十神，混通三界三百六十神，各生一天三百六十宫，各生一岁三百六十日，又生一月三百六十时，各生人身三百六十骨，普生一地三百六十名山。 下通天气，八景齐临，上灌生津，合气同植。 无极三界，普禀此原，天人相通，万境通贯。 八景开化，应象立原，二十四帝上生三百六十神，六位而成，合为六十四梵气。 六位相合，三十有二，三十二岁，天一周也。

Lord Ning addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: In former times, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, within the Bright Rosy Clouds Observatory of the Great Luo Heaven, responded to the realm of arising existence and expounded the Three Caverns and their thirty-six divisions.

The twelve scriptures of the Upper Grade of the Great Cavern possess the merit of all the Three Caverns’ thirty-six revered scriptures. Why is this so? The sagely teachings of the Great Cavern universally give rise to immortals and transcendents, encompassing all scriptures and their attendant offices. Thus, there are the merits of the Upper Grade of the thirty-six divisions within the Caverns of Mystery and Spirit. The Cavern of Mystery does not extend to the uppermost but only reaches the lower, while it embraces the Cavern of Spirit, hence possessing the power of the twenty-four divisions of true transcendents. The immortals’ scriptures of the Cavern of Spirit do not reach the uppermost but only hold the merit of the twelve divisions’ scriptures for giving rise to immortals.

The Three Caverns respond to transformation, universally initiating the source of arising; the Three Treasures guide and receive, with distinctions between the coarse and the subtle. From the subtlety of the Dao, the qi descends in traces to give rise to spirit. From non-being, being arises; from being, non-being is possessed. Comprehending the Great Dao in its embodiment, one arouses the unsurpassed mind, liberates from non-action, and abides in the eternal joy of the self’s contention.

The true teachings of the Cavern of Mystery, the middle vehicle responding to conditions, descend from the sagely to the true, penetrating the mysterious to enter the subtle. Thus, they expound responsive transformation, opening the gate of expedient means. Knowing being as non-being, one arises from being to cultivate, without the mind of attachment or defilement, departing from the realm of action to practice right contemplation and dwell in the Middle Way.

The immortals’ teachings of the Cavern of Spirit, lodged in preparatory causes and conditions, establish the offices of the various heavens and their attendants, transforming humans and spirits, and establishing all dharmas. The Three Treasures universally transform, with immortality as the gate of arising. From arising, one arises to cultivate, entering the formless body. Thus, responsive transformation is revealed: the yang of immortality arises first, from arising one ascends to immortality, from immortality one ascends to the true, from the true one ascends to the sagely, and from the sagely one ascends to the Dao.

The wondrous being of the Three Caverns takes qi as its origin. The origin arises from the beginning, the beginning from the primordial, and the primordial from the mysterious. The beginning qi communicates with the sagely, giving rise above to the Jade Clarity; the primordial qi presides over the true, giving rise in the middle to the Highest Clarity; the mysterious presides over the immortals’ teachings, giving rise below to the Grand Clarity. The Three Clarities respond to images, the Three Treasures universally descend, the thirty-six divisions respond to heavenly instruction, the thirty-six heavens are the roots of the Three Caverns’ arising, the three realms receive qi according to their realms and cultivate their grades. Seventy-two marks manifest the forms of their realms, eighty-one excellences express the great being of arising.

Thus, during the Dragon Han kalpa, he was named the Formless Heavenly Worthy, responding as the Heavenly Treasure Sagely Lord of Jade Clarity, serving as the revered Jade Emperor of the Great Cavern. He gave rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine billion myriad qi, each qi giving rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine billion myriad miles, each qi giving rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine billion myriad years. When the years and miles reached their end, their divisions combined and extended downward to the three realms, forming the great kalpa.

Next, during the Red Clarity kalpa, he was named the Nameless Heavenly Worthy, responding as the Numinous Treasure Perfected Lord of Highest Clarity, serving as the revered Lord of the Cavern of Mystery. He gave rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine myriad qi, each qi giving rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine myriad miles, each qi giving rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine myriad years. When the years and miles reached their end, their divisions combined and extended downward to the three realms, forming the middle kalpa.

Next, during the Highest Sovereign kalpa, he was named the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, serving as the revered spirit of the Cavern of Spirit. He gave rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety myriad qi, each qi giving rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine myriad miles, each qi giving rise to ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine myriad years. When the years and miles reached their end, their divisions combined and extended downward to the three realms, forming the lesser kalpa.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: Now, responding to images, my realm pervades my body, manifesting above to the various heavens and responding below to the myriad images. Through kalpas of responsive transformation, I open the path to salvation for countless beings. The superior worthies of the Dao descend to serve as masters and preceptors, or are born in the lower realms, mingling with beings in obscurity, assuming forms to communicate with the mundane. Sinking and floating, indistinguishable, they transform in accord with the Dao, responding to and receiving those with karmic affinity. For those who receive these scriptures, they open wisdom and understanding, silently practicing salvation without claiming merit, with pure resolve and clear spirit, to proclaim this Dharma.

Lord Ning further addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: The Three Clarities and Nine Emperors, the eight luminaries universally pervading all directions, respond to the arising of the three realms, universally serving as guides. Descending to the three realms, they give form to all grades of beings, opening the minds of heavenly and human beings, who together receive their offices.

Thus, the mysterious, primordial, and beginning qi each give rise to eight luminaries, forming the twenty-four emperors. The nine heavens each give rise to eight luminaries, forming the seventy-two offices. The twenty-four emperors transform into twenty-four spirits, the twenty-four spirits transform into twenty-four qi. Qi also becomes spirit, spirit also becomes qi. Scattered, they become clouds and mists; gathered, they become forms and shadows. Emerging, they become creation and transformation; entering, they become the True One. Above, they conjoin the Three Origins, giving rise to the myriad things in speech.

The transformations of spirit and the true have no fixed names. Among the hundred spirits, all form virtue through the union of three. At the ultimate of heaven and earth, the upper realm has twenty-four emperors, and below, the three realms have twenty-four qi. The twenty-four emperors each have three origins, each origin has five spirits, together giving rise to three hundred sixty spirits. Intermingling through the three realms, the three hundred sixty spirits each give rise to one heaven with three hundred sixty palaces, each giving rise to one year with three hundred sixty days, and one month with three hundred sixty hours. Each gives rise to the three hundred sixty bones of the human body and universally gives rise to the three hundred sixty famous mountains of the earth.

Below, the heavenly qi communicate, the eight luminaries descend in unison, above they irrigate the vital fluids, conjoining qi to plant together. The boundless three realms universally receive this origin. Heaven and humans communicate, all realms universally pervade. The eight luminaries open transformation, responding to images to establish the origin. The twenty-four emperors above give rise to three hundred sixty spirits, forming through six positions, combining into sixty-four brahma qi. The six positions conjoin, forming thirty-two, and thirty-two years make one cycle of Heavenly One.

chunks.original_text: 故明三界三十二天。 三清九气，上下通神，傍贯璇玑，四运明朗。 三洞天历，岁为三元，六位阳辰，为六斋月。 八景通运，八节修门，十直朝尊，奉修十善。 烧香愿念，功感诸天，然灯续明，拔生救死，香花宝盖，供养诸天，转读尊经，令通慧解，上忏七祖先代宿殃，下为含灵同滋法泽。 三清众圣俯鉴丹诚，三界宫属同垂监瑛，三宫清净，九户圆明，五藏晓彻，六府通慧。 八十一好，光生八十一关机，三十二相，通明三百六十骨，三十二帝表现玄虚，三十六天显登顶相。 八景备卫，九天翼形，驾景策龙，上登玉清也。 宁君告黄帝曰：大道生化，无物不通，大包无外，细入无间，无物不禀，元物不生，无物不度，无物不成。 开廓太空，分为十等，从上大罗下及三清，而为七分，上及傍普，皆备太空，以为道境，故玄都玉京山上，而有七觉之气也。 大罗已下而生三境，合为七分，傍备太空，通为圣境。 复次三清八方正中，各於其下又为一分，而生比地五亿亿、五万亿、五千亿、五百亿、五十亿、五五亿等。 无极三界，皆感五气五运生成，故通天地五十五数。 三元上下，皆以三洞合通九帝、一十二天，总合三元三十六帝。 正中八方普禀三清，唯感四序三十二天、三百六十度，以成二十八宿。 五运生化，虽感道原，分应通凡，从上第八分也。 复次各於无极三界已下，又为一分，以为九垒三十六土皇。 皆禀三界，上通三清，每年八节四季之日，录人善恶，上奏三清。 善恶罪福，上下计会，此通从上第九分也。 复次九垒之下，而有八门九幽地狱，上是阳考，下主阴罚，上下各九，亦名十八大地狱也。 於此狱下大风泽之炁，似风非风，似水非水，识苦性昏，不可分别，擎持地轮，全不倾倒，此是从上第十分也。 宁君告黄帝曰：三洞通化，九气混生，天有三十．六曹君，地有三十六司府。 三境下降，九气通生，九垒上腾，三界通感。 一天境域，二景合明，三光齐临，四绪咸备，璇玑混合，总统弥罗，广覆生神，应气成熟。 周天历纪运度玄关，九垒土神各为比地。 太岁太阴大将军，岁德建破之神。 若有行人奉修三洞三清上经，当勉下地九土灵祇，不为作害。 故第一之地名元德，其气上青中黄，是元土卿所治，厚一万一千一百一十里，土象百官悉治其中。 第二之地皇德，其气通黑，是元庭土丞所治，土家百官亦治其中。 第三之地帝德，其气通苍，是虎口土龙所治，土家百官亦治其中。 第四之地王德，其气通黄，是元心土大将军所治。 第五之地人德，其气通赤，是元福土令所治。 第六之地地德，其气通白，是元骨土长所治。 第七之地里德，其气通紫，是始甲六父母所治。 第八之地复德，其气通青，是始贤土宗正所治。 第九之地昌德，其气通绿，是轩始土下有二千石所治。 九地土官，各管土府，上通比地十二神官也。 上清太上开天龙蹻经卷之二 上清太上开天龙蹻经卷之三

Thus are the Three Realms and the thirty-two heavens made manifest. The Three Clarities and the nine qi communicate with the divine above and below, laterally penetrating the celestial pivot, with the four movements shining brightly. The Three Caverns’ celestial reckoning marks the year as three origins, the six yang positions and celestial stems as the six fasting months. The eight luminaries circulate their motion, the eight nodes as the gates of cultivation; the ten straight days for venerating the honored, upholding and practicing the ten virtues. Burning incense and vowing mindfulness, merits move the various heavens; lighting lamps to continue brightness, delivering the living and rescuing the dead. Fragrant flowers and jeweled canopies offer reverence to the various heavens; reciting and reading the honored scriptures enables penetrating wisdom and understanding. Above, repenting for the seven generations of ancestors and former transgressions; below, for all sentient beings to equally receive the moisture of the Dharma’s grace. The multitude of sages of the Three Clarities condescend to witness the cinnabar sincerity; the palace attendants of the Three Realms together bestow their luminous oversight. The Three Palaces are pure and serene, the nine portals perfectly radiant; the five viscera dawn with clarity, the six bowels communicate wisdom. The eighty-one excellences give rise to light in the eighty-one joints; the thirty-two marks illuminate the three hundred sixty bones. The thirty-two emperors manifest the mysterious and empty; the thirty-six heavens display the ascent to the summit’s appearance. The eight luminaries are fully arrayed in guard, the nine heavens wing the form, riding the luminous and spurring the dragon to ascend the Jade Clarity.

Ning Jun addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: The great Dao of generation and transformation communicates with all things, nothing excluded; vast, it encompasses without boundary, minute, it enters without gap. Nothing fails to receive it, yet nothing gives rise to it; nothing fails to be delivered, nothing fails to be perfected. It opens and expands the great void, dividing it into ten ranks. From the Great Luo above down to the Three Clarities, it forms seven divisions; above and all around, all is encompassed by the great void, established as the realm of the Dao. Thus, upon the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain, there are the seven qi of enlightenment.

Below the Great Luo arise the Three Realms, together forming seven divisions, all around encompassing the great void, communicating as the sacred realm. Furthermore, the Three Clarities and the eight directions’ central points each form another division below, giving rise to the five hundred million myriad, five myriad myriad, five thousand myriad, five hundred myriad, fifty myriad, and five times fifty myriad. The boundless Three Realms all respond to the five qi and five movements to generate and complete, thus communicating the fifty-five numbers of Heaven and Earth. The three origins above and below all unite the Three Caverns to communicate with the nine emperors and twelve heavens, altogether forming the three origins and thirty-six emperors. The central point and eight directions universally receive the Three Clarities, only responding to the four seasons and thirty-two heavens, the three hundred sixty degrees, to complete the twenty-eight lodges. Though the five movements generate and transform, responding to the origin of the Dao, they divide and correspond to the ordinary, from the eighth division above.

Furthermore, each forms another division below the boundless Three Realms, establishing the nine ramparts and thirty-six earthly emperors. All receive the Three Realms, communicating above with the Three Clarities. On each year’s eight nodes and four seasonal days, they record human good and evil, reporting above to the Three Clarities. Good and evil, transgressions and blessings are calculated and tallied above and below—this communicates from the ninth division above. Below the nine ramparts are the eight gates and nine dark hells; above are the yang examiners, below the yin punishers. Above and below, each nine, also named the eighteen great earthly hells. Beneath these hells is the great wind-marsh qi, resembling wind yet not wind, resembling water yet not water, where suffering dulls perception, distinctions cannot be made, supporting and sustaining the earthly wheel without the slightest tilt—this is from the tenth division above.

Ning Jun addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: The Three Caverns communicate transformation, the nine qi intermingle and arise. Heaven has thirty-six bureau lords, Earth has thirty-six administrative offices. The Three Realms descend, the nine qi communicate and arise; the nine ramparts ascend, the Three Realms communicate and respond. One heavenly realm’s domain, two luminaries unite in brightness, three lights descend in unison, four threads are all prepared, the celestial pivot intermingles and unites, governing and encompassing the vast expanse. It broadly covers the gods of generation, responding to qi to bring maturity. The celestial reckoning of the revolving heavens and the degrees of the mysterious passes, the nine-rampart earth gods each form a comparative earth. The Great Year, Great Yin, and Great General, the deities of the year’s virtue, establishment, and destruction.

If there are practitioners who uphold and cultivate the Three Caverns’ Three Clarities’ upper scriptures, they should earnestly entreat the nine earthly numina of the lower realms, that they may not cause harm. Thus, the first earth is named Primal Virtue; its qi is green above and yellow within. It is governed by the Minister of Primal Earth, with a depth of eleven thousand one hundred ten li, where the earthly bureaucracy all resides within. The second earth is August Virtue; its qi is black throughout. It is governed by the Assistant Minister of Primal Court, where the earthly bureaucracy also resides within. The third earth is Imperial Virtue; its qi is blue-green throughout. It is governed by the Tiger-Mouth Earth Dragon, where the earthly bureaucracy also resides within. The fourth earth is Kingly Virtue; its qi is yellow throughout. It is governed by the Great General of Primal Heart Earth. The fifth earth is Human Virtue; its qi is red throughout. It is governed by the Magistrate of Primal Blessing Earth. The sixth earth is Earthly Virtue; its qi is white throughout. It is governed by the Elder of Primal Bone Earth. The seventh earth is Village Virtue; its qi is purple throughout. It is governed by the Six Parents of Beginning Jia. The eighth earth is Returning Virtue; its qi is green throughout. It is governed by the Ancestral Rectifier of Beginning Worth Earth. The ninth earth is Flourishing Virtue; its qi is greenish throughout. Thus within yang, yin becomes Wood; within yang, yang becomes Fire. Within yin, yang becomes Metal; within yin, yin becomes Water. The harmony within harmony becomes Earth.

The qi of lesser yang each constitute one heaven, all forming the Azure Heavens of the nine qi in the East, giving rise to the Great August Yellow-Canopy Heaven and the Great Brightness Jade Sovereign, corresponding to the Orthodox Unity. Within this ninefold unity, the inner reveals its empty function—serene and vast, the primordial aperture—thus manifesting as the rare. Subtle and unobstructed, it appears as the level. Wondrously discerning without fixed form, it responds as the subtle. Vastly encompassing without beyond, it universally pervades as emptiness. Harmoniously receiving and containing, it flows unimpeded as the cavernous. Open and unobstructed, it responds as the wondrously non-existent.

Within this wondrous non-existence, it gradually manifests in accord with the teachings, revealing the intent-spirit, then establishing the will-spirit, followed by the念-spirit. The three念 unfold their traces, responding to the teachings to initiate function. Thus from orthodox wisdom arises true wisdom; from true wisdom arises expedient wisdom. Within this expedient wisdom, the Three Treasures are revealed: essence, spirit, and qi.

Essence is governed by numinous wisdom; spirit is unfathomable, its achievement lying in transformation; qi is the qi-phase, its function in generation. Though their functions differ, they are called the Three; as their substance is indivisible, they are named the Three-in-One.

Within this Three-in-One, three bodies are further revealed: first, the body of form and mind; second, the body of the Three Caverns; third, the body of wondrous virtue. The body of form and mind refers to the quiescent foundation of the self, with the true one’s wondrous wisdom as its essence. The body of the Three Caverns refers to the stages of cultivation, establishing the origin in accord with the ranks, verifying fruition and ascending positions, broadly delivering all beings—this is great wisdom. Originally, form is a fetter, obstructing the stages of ascent. From the Nine Sages downward, all seek to advance in rank. Bound by desires and fetters, all speak of having form; when the fetters of the true Dao are exhausted, only wondrous mind remains.

Verifying the Dao-fruit above, possessing all virtues, quiescent and invisible, it is named the wondrously non-existent. When active, it adapts to encounters, sharing substance with things. Though mind and form are wondrous, they become visible to beings—thus named the wondrously existent. By position, it responds to retribution, forming the ascent to the mysterious. Progressing to ascend as the highest sage, reaching the supreme sagely fruit, forgetting cause and forgetting fruit, naturally aligning with the true nature, merging with the great Dao, blending indistinguishably with things—none surpasses this height, hence it is first called the Heavenly Venerable.

Thus from the Heavenly Venerable, the response-body gradually manifests, generating realms. The primordial qi of the Mysterious, Original, and Beginning pervades the body’s radiance. The three qi transform into forms, unfolding the Three Caverns. The Beginning becomes azure light, ascending to generate heaven; the Original becomes white light, arising in the midst to generate humanity; the Mysterious becomes yellow light, descending to generate earth. From these three hues, the Heavenly Venerable of the Original Beginning coalesces to generate nine lights, universally emanating the Dharma-body, its luminosity penetratingly radiant.

First arising from the Chaotic, the Chaotic becomes deep azure light; from the Chaotic arises the Cavernous, the Cavernous becomes crimson light; from the Cavernous arises the Vast, the Vast becomes azure light; from the Original arises the Luminous, the Luminous becomes green light; from the Luminous arises the Scenic, the Scenic becomes yellow light; from the Scenic arises the Fleeting, the Fleeting becomes white light; from the Mysterious arises the Fusing, the Fusing becomes purple light; from the Fusing arises the Blazing, the Blazing becomes jade-green light; from the Blazing arises the Unfolding, the Unfolding becomes raven-black light. From these nine lights, realms are universally generated: above arise the three realms and thirty-six heavens, revealing the celestial countenance, empty and cavernously luminous; below arise the three realms and thirty-six Emperors, provisionally responding with transformed bodies, bestowing blessings upon the gate of life, gradually and suddenly guiding to tranquility—hence named the Three Caverns and thirty-six forms.

Ning Jun addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: "Formerly, I received from the Heavenly Venerable in the Great Canopy Heaven the *Scripture of the Heavenly Establishment of the Original Grades*, entrusting the body to establish forms. Within the myriad-image Dharma-gate, the inner is quiescent, the Dharma-body responding as the transformed body. The body’s radiance penetrates and shines, manifesting the mysterious and empty, responding to forms to generate heavens, thereby perfecting forms and excellences.

Form is the root, arising from quiescence to proclaim; excellence is the trace, through speech to clarify principle. Thus the manifested body-forms penetrate all heavens; within forms, excellences arise, further revealing the generated body. The nine lights penetrate and shine, above and below universally radiant. The nine heavens layer upon one another, each generating the eight directions, internally containing the nine heavens, with root and trace doubly responding. The eighty-one excellences universally pervade form and spirit; the thirty-six divisions verify affinities without obstruction. The ninefold unity universally transforms, wondrously discerning without fixed form. The nine-colored treasure lights, with the first unity as the principal, the primordial qi of the Mysterious, Original, and Beginning coalesce to generate nine gates. The three appellations each have three, hence the ninefold unity.

**Chapter Eight: The Original Establishment of the Thirty-Six Forms of the Three Pure Ones’ Response Bodies**

Ning Jun addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: In former times, I received the Heavenly Venerable One’s decree in the Great Brahmā Heaven, where I expounded the *Scripture of the Original Establishment of the Primordial* to all the great sages. My body generated seventy-two response forms, ascending to the three realms and thirty-six heavens above, and descending to the three realms and thirty-six emperors below.

The thirty-six divisions constitute the three Caverns’ Dharma gates, the nine grades of transformation, and the ten thousand images’ fundamental source. Born from the primordial origin of heaven, this is called the Heavenly Venerable One, the Supreme Dharma King, styled the Jade Emperor.

The thirty-six divisions form the mysterious ladder of realms; the thirty-six heavens ascend through the three Caverns’ grades.

The primordial *qi* of the Mysterious Origin, triply conjoined, composes the body, its nine-colored precious radiance enveloping this Dharma-form.

At first, the primordial chaotic *qi* coalesced into a verdant light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. This verdant manifestation, flourishing and exuberant, spread its variegated hues, named *Yudan*. Vastly equipped to open and generate life, it responds with boundless forms, verifies fruition, and establishes ranks. Ascending to the Jade Clarity above, its merit and virtue are immeasurable. Having first attained the sagely fruit, it thus establishes the *Yudan* Immeasurable Heaven and the Nine Heavens’ Elder, leader of all virtues.

Thus, the first *Upper Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Formless Pure Subtle Heaven.
Next, the second *Lofty Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Primordial Essence *Pāramārtha* Heaven.
Next, the third *Great Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the □-Colored Immeasurable Virtue *Dhara* Heaven.

Proceeding to the second sequence: the chaotic *qi* generates the Cavern, which becomes a crimson light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests the body of meditative goodness, enabling the cultivation of meditative virtue. With boundless lifespan, it is thus named the *Uppermost Meditative Virtue Heaven* and the Nine Heavens’ True King. Perfecting the middle sagely Dao, its blessed retribution is immeasurable, and this heaven is established, its divine transformations wondrous.

Thus, the fourth *Divine Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Mysterious Subtle Upper Void *Yuyu* Heaven.
Next, the fifth *Mysterious Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Mysterious Clarity *Nāgaśiras* Pure Heaven.
Next, the sixth *True Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Brahmā-Conduct *Ketu* Border Pure Heaven.

Proceeding to the third sequence: the Cavern generates the Vast, which becomes a blue light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests the elevation of those who cultivate longevity, revealing the three *qi* to open and deliver the obscure and the luminous. Thus named the *Brahmā-Supervisor Xu Yan Heaven* and the Primordial Heavenly King, it penetrates the real and verifies the sagely.

Thus, the seventh *Immortal Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Mysterious Brahmā *Rāga* Pure Bright Heaven.
Next, the eighth *Spiritual Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Primordial Uppermost Spiritual Red Heaven.
Next, the ninth *Supreme Sage Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Great Brahmā-Conduct *Tathā* Heaven.

Proceeding to the fourth sequence: the Primordial generates the Vast, which becomes a green light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests solemn quiescence and soundlessness, broadly accommodating and universally delivering. Its virtuous deeds universally embrace, ascending to advance the Dao’s realm. Thus named the *Quiescent Doushu Heaven* and the Primordial Heavenly King, it establishes true and real wisdom.

Thus, the first *Upper Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Precious Radiance Mysterious Wondrous Heaven.
Next, the second *Lofty Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Flying Brahmā Blessed Virtue Heaven.
Next, the third *Grand Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Void Brahmā Border Pure Heaven.

Proceeding to the fifth sequence: the Vast generates the Scenery, which becomes a yellow light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests the practitioner’s joy without arrogance, its blessings and secrecy belonging to them. Thus named the *Unarrogant Joy Heaven* and the Lofty Primordial August Sovereign, teaching the true Dao within.

Thus, the fourth *Divine Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Great Brahmā Near Border Heaven.
Next, the fifth *Mysterious Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Conduct Brahmā Swift Benefit Heaven.
Next, the sixth *Immortal Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Void No Attachment Heaven.

Proceeding to the sixth sequence: the Scenery generates the Reclusion, which becomes a white light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests the true Dao’s resonance with sound, thoroughly cultivating the true precepts to prevent confusion and disorder. Some fear the demon kings’ resonant transformations, which follow desires to disturb practitioners. Responding to these forms, it deeply restricts desires, thus revealing this heaven to prevent regression. Thus named the *Cavern Origin Resonant Transformation Heaven*, its heavenly lord is the Void August Jade Emperor, who proclaims the correct conduct.

Thus, the seventh *Heavenly Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Great Brahmā Virtue Heaven.
Next, the eighth *Spiritual Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Brahmā-Conduct *Sudatta* Heaven.
Next, the ninth *Supreme Perfected Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Ultimate Brahmā *Āṭana* Heaven.

Proceeding to the seventh sequence: the Mysterious generates the Fusion, which becomes a purple light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests the numinous transformation’s governance, boundless and limitless across the three realms, universally supervising the heavenly passes. All ascend as the middle grade; above, they form the seven origins, universally serving as humanity’s head. Penetrating the seven gates, it is thus named the *Numinous Transformation Brahmā-Assistant Heaven* and the *Wanshi* Primordial Master, universally generating the wondrous chaos. Responding as the immortals’ lord, it governs the gates of life.

Thus, the first *Upper Immortal Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Penetrating Brahmā Virtue Heaven.
Next, the second *Lofty Immortal Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Void Brahmā Wisdom Heaven.
Next, the third *Heavenly Immortal Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Empty Brahmā *Idaṃ* Heaven.

Proceeding to the eighth sequence: the Fusion generates the Flame, which becomes a jade-green light, independent of sun and moon, naturally luminous. It manifests the layered empyrean’s emptiness, lofty and distant, pure and bright, penetratingly illuminating. Its lustrous mirror reflects forms, descending the three origins’ *qi* to generate humanity’s three palaces. Internally, it forms the five viscera, nine palaces, and canopy; above, it corresponds to the golden efflorescence and the heavenly efflorescence palace. Thus named the *Lofty Void Pure Bright Heaven* and the Imperial Perfected, the efflorescence palace’s life origin.

The Purple Void Emperor Lord universally irrigates the living bodies. The people of this heaven, through lofty deeds and conduct, ascend to the layered empyrean above, transcending the three realms. Advancing in immortal grades, they ascend the liberation gate.

Thus, the fourth *Divine Immortal Verification Grade* is revealed, establishing the Conditioned Brahmā Wisdom Entry Heaven.

**The Primordial Beginning’s Transformation of Form: Establishing the Three Clarities and Thirty-Six Aspects, Chapter the Eleventh**

Ning Jun addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: In former times, I received the Heavenly Venerable One’s mandate in the Great Luo Heaven, where I expounded the *Scripture of the Primordial Establishment of Heaven’s Origins* as the Emperor of All Heavens. Borne in form and manifesting appearance, I left traces of my realm’s boundaries.

The Mysterious Primordial qi, shared by the Nine Sages in their entirety, perfected the seventy-two aspects throughout gods and humans, their nine-colored bodily radiance penetrating and illuminating all with clarity. The upper section undergoes nine transformations, its three realms interflowing in form; the middle section’s nine apertures interlink with the Nine Ones in transformation; the lower section’s nine names interflow with the Nine Lands in spirit. The thirty-six aspects reveal themselves through the Three Palaces.

The head mirrors the Great Luo, perfectly interpenetrating without obstruction. The brain contains nine palaces, corresponding to the nine heavens’ responsive forms. The heart holds nine apertures, through which the Nine Sages perceive with luminous clarity. The lower section’s nine names correspond to the descending bodily forms.

As for the brain’s nine palaces:
The first is the Supreme August Palace, where the Most High Lord and Queen reside;
The second is the Jade Emperor’s Palace, where the Jade Clarity Divine Lord resides;
The third is the Heavenly Court Palace, where the Upper Clarity Divine Lord resides;
The fourth is the Ultimate Perfection Palace, where the Supreme Ultimate Divine Lord resides;
The fifth is the Mysterious Cinnabar Palace, where the Perfected Lord resides;
The sixth is the Flowing Pearl Palace, where the Divine Immortals reside;
The seventh is the Cinnabar Field Palace, where the Upper Prime’s Red Child, the True Person and Imperial Lord, and the Minister of the Heavenly Emperor reside;
The eighth is the Grotto Chamber Palace, where on the left dwells the Peerless Lad, on the right the White Prime Lord, and in the center the Yellow Elder’s Three Hun reside;
The ninth is the Hall of Brightness Palace, where on the left dwells the Bright Youth Perfected Official, on the right the Bright Maiden Perfected Official, and in the center the Bright Mirror Perfected Official.

The Great One True Person is the brain’s essence, generating humanity’s Three Primes and the nine palaces’ life-spirits.

The middle Crimson Palace’s heart holds nine apertures, interlinked with the Nine Perfected. The Middle Prime True Person dwells in its central palace, where the Cinnabar Sovereign and the August Minister jointly govern the Crimson Palace, upholding the Way of the Crimson Palace’s Nine Perfected. Harmonizing with all things, they manifest as the Utmost Person; transforming without limit, they manifest as the Sage; in true purity and wondrous transformation, they manifest as the Perfected Person; universally delivering and ascending, they manifest as the Immortal; in unimpeded divine penetration, they manifest as the Divine Person; penetrating existence and nonexistence, they manifest as the Numinous Person; in wondrous discernment and subtle penetration, they manifest as the Worthy Person; embracing the Dao and cherishing virtue, they manifest as the Dao Person; in meritorious deeds and universal salvation, they manifest as the Practitioner.

The heart’s nine apertures generate nine persons, nine kinds of universal penetration, completing the middle aspect’s single form.

The Lower Prime’s Infant guards the Primordial Yang Palace, enthroned as the Yellow Court’s Primordial King. On the right, the Protector Minister guards the Lower Prime’s Yellow Court Palace. The Peach Vitality Lord’s essence interflows with the mysterious image of purple auroras, threefold encircling yellow clouds, fourfold binding the womb’s embryo, master of the Life Gate’s life-spirits. Above, it interlinks with the nine heavens; below, with the nine earths. Within, it generates the body’s nine spirits, above which are nine persons, arrayed in threes. On the left is Han Zhong, on the right Fan Li, and in the center the Great Accomplished Master. The left kidney is the Minister of Instruction, the right kidney the Minister of Works, and in the center the Great One Lord. On the left is the Azure Waist Jade Maiden, on the right the White Simplicity Jade Maiden, and in the center the Mysterious Radiance Jade Maiden.

The Mysterious Radiance Jade Maiden is the Dao’s primordial qi, mother of generation and completion. Descending qi to the lower womb’s palace, the Three Clarities’ wondrous transformations and nine qi’s descent of spirits generate humanity’s Three Palaces and twenty-seven positions, internally uniting the nine spirits and thirty-six aspects.

**The Primordial Beginning’s Transformation of Form: Generating the Three Realms and Thirty-Six Aspects, Chapter the Twelfth**

Ning Jun addressed the Yellow Emperor, saying: In former times, I received the Heavenly Venerable One’s mandate in the Great Luo Heaven, where I expounded the *Scripture of the Primordial Establishment of Heaven’s Origins*. Borne in form and manifesting appearance, I responded with bodily generation in heaven, unfolding the transformation of human spirits and universally extending manifest images.

Above, as the Three Clarities’ formless transforming lords, the thirty-six Heavenly Venerables descend to generate the Three Realms’ responsive transformations, establishing the forms of the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors. The two luminaries interflow in motion, the Five Unions generate and complete, each becoming the Heavenly Pass and Heavenly Sovereign Great Emperor, the Eastern Culmen’s Central Stellar Center. I serve as their foremost, father of humanity’s generation.

From the Dao’s father and mother, entrusted with karmic conditions, I lodged in yin and yang’s transformations to complete bodily existence. Azure Yang’s primordial qi becomes the Supreme Yang’s essence, the Eastern King Father. The Supreme Harmony’s qi becomes the Yin’s essence, the Western Queen Mother. Above, it binds the Four Brahmās, the Three Realms’ crown of heaven; below, it governs Kunlun, above interlinking with the nine qi. Ninefold golden walls, twelve jade towers, universally govern the two luminaries and the Four Movements’ [missing characters].

Above, it generates the human eye, interlinking with the sun and moon’s radiance; below, it generates the two breasts, where the sun and moon converge. Day and night ascend and descend, fortune and misfortune alternate, heaven and humanity share the Dao, though dark and manifest differ in appearance.

The Three Clarities’ Three Venerables, the Imperial One and Great One’s Imperial Lords and other spirits universally generate gods and humans, all endowed with qi and image. The boundless wondrous unity congeals as the Purple Chamber, the heavenly kingly qi above becoming the brain’s essence. The head, round in imitation of heaven, the crown as the Mysterious Canopy, is the hundred spirits’ numinous ancestral seat and the body’s dwelling. The fluid mountain springs are the body’s life-master; the head is the lofty terrace, mirroring heaven’s Kunlun. Hair is the Hall of Brightness, where morning stars descend in essence; the brain holds nine palaces, interlinked with the Three Clarities. The face is the foot’s dwelling, the Perfected Person’s palace, above interlinking with the seven portals, the Seven Primes’ mutual communication. The body is the jade tree, the feet the earthly pass, the mouth the heart’s pass, the hands the heavenly pass. Eyebrows are the White Prime, humanity’s floral canopy, above as the convergence point uniting the Three Primes.

The Imperial Lord’s generative qi nurtures the divine youths; the left and right Perfected Persons interlink radiance and penetrate vision. From this, the Great One interlinks with the sun and moon’s spirits, the left as the King Father, whose solar radiance nourishes the body, the right as the Queen Mother, whose lunar radiance stabilizes the form. The nose is the heavenly gate, interlinking with heaven’s jade fluids, the Golden Treasury’s realm, the spirit’s gate and portal.

chunks.original_text: 故应化身，妙一成立，在天天一，在人人一，在地地一，同感妙一，两半生神。 三元肇分，八景成别，上一散为二十四真，中一散为二十四神，下一散为二十四贤。 三元八景七十二神，依变七十二方经，三天各二十四帝，内含九宫八十有一，故应九九而生其好。 上元八景洞真部，中元八景洞玄部，下元八景洞神部，三部八景二十四神，正是二十四气。 气亦成神，神亦成气，散之为云雾，合之为形影，出之为造化，入之为真一。 上结三元，下结万物，神真变化，无有定名，百神中皆以三洞三合成德。 天地之极上境二十四帝者，正是下方二十四气是也。 二十四帝，帝各三元，合七十二元，元各五神，而生三界三百六十神，合为六十四梵气，混气三十二天帝。 故生一天三百六十神，一人三百六十骨。 上为三宫，生人二十七天关； 中为三宫，生人二十七神机； 下为三宫，生人二十七灵节。 混通三元，八十有一，因兹法象，而植形神，通道生津，始成灵识，故应生人八十一好也。 宁君告黄帝曰：吾昔承元始天尊，而演三洞身光相好，应化通生七十二相，本迹双显，上生三境福力庄严无量功德三十六相，下生三界应报见生善恶命根。 随缘感宅，故应三界三十六相，境界通应，以示人天三身，各显七十二相。 内明三洞而植其神，外显通生始应天体，於此天象通象生人，普植黎元，皆察三洞三十六门，而生神识三十六相。 三洞通玄七十二相，境界相贯八十一好，九九化生三身应相。 三度通应，皆从九一，而生九天九色宝光，通为九户，遍兹境界，广备太空，并感道源，而成识用，外通玄象，俱是化身，内静虚通，是吾正性也。 是时黄帝拜受宁君，请问大道通生於人。 宁君为演上宣玉帝生天化体，应相成人，三洞化形，九天合德，天人通贯，法象齐临，妙一同滋，五德咸备，开天要诀。 释滞除疑，晓洞玄津，迩趣遐感。 又白请问启宁君曰：三洞圣路，元始通生，天通於人，人通於道，德道修真，玄关何在？ 宁君答曰：神符告命，万帝俱朝，佩服矫符，三洞通启，九地保举，八景营形，圣境真乡，潜升往至。 汝可谛听，受吾蹻符，升虚入无，皆从此起。 经是径路，趣道来由，符是玄枢，入道法户也。 黄帝拜谢，又白启曰：生天相好，感象成躯，神净身明，入道方急，志求仙路，愿示宝文，幸及神颜赐垂圣目，请乞受持，奉修秘旨。 育君告黄帝曰：元始应相，境界垂形，天人相通，报力随感，九天应化，尚自不同，九品上人，骨相皆别，轻重有异，报应无差，夙有玄名，始有仙相。 汝先代有慧，庆及今生，升入仙阶，奉吾此箓。 大道无象，应相立形，应相生天，始名相体。 凡学仙道，未可即成，皆藉先缘，仙相后感。 言龙蹻符者，云纲蹻举，升虚入无，乘气御龙，上至玉帝，元始告命，太上为宣，方始至於遣吾传授也。 吾今宣道，为汝宣经，应感见吾，即吾非有，道通无外，授汝宝章，仙籍通天，天亦通汝，应合得道，名举将来，始受汝符，告命之信也。 神符神箓，元天命门，神印神经，三天告始，志念吞服，六符圆明，佩带灵图，七元通启，九天命召，九地奏名，神升於天，经道双显。 符经异目，受说不同，次授蹻符，别为一录，可传后代有道圣君，密而修之，非贤不度也。

Thus the responsive transformation body, wondrously unified in oneness, is one with Heaven in Heaven, one with humanity in humanity, and one with Earth on Earth. In mutual resonance with the wondrous oneness, the two halves generate spirit.

The Three Origins first divide, and the Eight Sceneries take distinct forms. The Upper One scatters into the Twenty-Four Perfected, the Middle One into the Twenty-Four Spirits, and the Lower One into the Twenty-Four Worthies. The Three Origins, Eight Sceneries, and Seventy-Two Spirits follow the Seventy-Two Directions Scripture in their transformations. Each of the Three Heavens has Twenty-Four Emperors, internally containing the Nine Palaces and Eighty-One, thus responding to the nine nines to generate their perfections.

The Upper Origin’s Eight Sceneries belong to the Cavern Real Department, the Middle Origin’s Eight Sceneries to the Cavern Mystery Department, and the Lower Origin’s Eight Sceneries to the Cavern Spirit Department. The Three Departments’ Eight Sceneries and Twenty-Four Spirits precisely correspond to the Twenty-Four Qi. Qi also becomes spirit, and spirit also becomes qi. Scattered, they form clouds and mist; gathered, they become form and shadow. Emerging, they are creation and transformation; entering, they are the True One.

Above, they bind the Three Origins; below, they bind the myriad things. The transformations of spirit and the Perfected have no fixed names. Among the hundred spirits, all are completed through the virtue of the Three Caverns’ threefold union.

The supreme realm of Heaven and Earth’s Twenty-Four Emperors precisely corresponds to the Twenty-Four Qi of the lower regions. Each of the Twenty-Four Emperors possesses Three Origins, totaling Seventy-Two Origins. Each Origin has Five Spirits, generating the Three Realms’ Three Hundred Sixty Spirits, which combine into Sixty-Four Brahma Qi. The mixed qi forms the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors.

Thus, one heaven generates Three Hundred Sixty Spirits, and one person has Three Hundred Sixty bones. Above, the Three Palaces generate humanity’s Twenty-Seven Heavenly Passes; in the middle, the Three Palaces generate humanity’s Twenty-Seven Spirit Mechanisms; below, the Three Palaces generate humanity’s Twenty-Seven Numinous Joints. Interpenetrating the Three Origins, they total Eighty-One. Through this dharma image, form and spirit are planted, the Dao is penetrated to generate fluid, and numinous consciousness first takes shape. Thus, they respond to generate humanity’s Eighty-One Perfections.

Lord Ning addressed the Yellow Emperor: “Formerly, I received from the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy the exposition of the Three Caverns’ body, light, and auspicious marks, the responsive transformation that universally generates the Seventy-Two Marks. Root and trace are doubly manifest: above, they generate the Three Realms’ boundless merit, adorned with the Thirty-Six Marks of virtuous power; below, they generate the Three Realms’ karmic responses, revealing the good and evil life-roots of sentient beings.

Following karmic conditions and dwelling-places, they respond to the Three Realms’ Thirty-Six Marks. The realms universally respond, demonstrating to humans and heavens the Three Bodies, each displaying the Seventy-Two Marks. Internally, the Three Caverns are illuminated to plant the spirit; externally, the universal generation first responds to the celestial body. Through this celestial image, the human form is universally generated, planting the black-haired people. All examine the Three Caverns’ Thirty-Six Gates, generating the spirit-consciousness and the Thirty-Six Marks.

The Three Caverns’ universal mystery manifests the Seventy-Two Marks. The realms interpenetrate, forming the Eighty-One Perfections. The nine nines transform to generate the Three Bodies’ responsive marks. Threefold universal resonance all arises from the nine ones, generating the Nine Heavens’ Nine-Colored Treasure Lights. These interpenetrate as Nine Gates, pervading these realms, universally preparing the Great Void. All respond to the Dao’s source, forming the function of consciousness. Externally, they interpenetrate the mysterious images—all are transformation bodies. Internally, in quiescent emptiness, they interpenetrate—this is my true nature.”

At that time, the Yellow Emperor bowed and received Lord Ning’s teaching, then inquired about the Great Dao’s universal generation of humanity.

Lord Ning expounded the Upper Proclamation of the Jade Emperor’s celestial transformation body, the responsive marks that form humanity, the Three Caverns’ transformation of form, the Nine Heavens’ union of virtue, the interpenetration of heaven and humanity, the equal advent of dharma images, the wondrous oneness’ shared nourishment, the Five Virtues’ complete preparation, and the essential secrets of Heaven’s Opening. He resolved doubts, dispelled obstructions, and illuminated the Cavern Mystery’s ford, drawing near to respond to distant resonances.

Again, the Yellow Emperor respectfully inquired of Lord Ning: “The Three Caverns’ sagely path, the Primordial Beginning’s universal generation—heaven interpenetrates humanity, humanity interpenetrates the Dao. Cultivating virtue and the Dao to refine the Real—where lies the mysterious pass?”

Lord Ning replied: “The spirit talismans proclaim the mandate; the myriad emperors all pay homage. Wearing and serving the talismans, the Three Caverns universally open. The Nine Lands protect and elevate; the Eight Sceneries shape the form. The sagely realm’s true homeland—secretly ascend and proceed there.

You may carefully listen and receive my *Soaring Talisman*. Ascending emptiness and entering nonbeing all begin here. This scripture is the path, the reason for pursuing the Dao. The talisman is the mysterious pivot, the dharma gate for entering the Dao.”

The Yellow Emperor bowed in gratitude, then respectfully inquired: “The celestial marks of birth, the responsive images forming the body—spirit purified, body luminous, the urgency of entering the Dao. Aspiring to the immortal path, I wish to behold the treasure scripture. I am fortunate to approach your numinous countenance and receive your sagely gaze. I humbly request to receive and uphold it, to reverently cultivate the secret instructions.”

Lord Ning addressed the Yellow Emperor: “The Primordial Beginning’s responsive marks, the realm’s bestowed form—heaven and humanity interpenetrate, karmic power follows resonance. The Nine Heavens’ responsive transformations are not uniform. The Nine Grades’ superior persons all differ in bone and mark, with variations in weight and gravity. Karmic responses are without error. Those with prior mysterious names first possess immortal marks.

Your former lives held wisdom; blessings extend to this life. Ascending the immortal ranks, receive this register from me. The Great Dao is without image; responsive marks establish form. Responsive marks generate heaven—this is called the mark-body.

All who study the immortal Dao cannot immediately succeed; all rely on prior conditions. Immortal marks respond later. The *Dragon’s Soaring Talisman*—the cloud net soars, ascending emptiness and entering nonbeing, riding qi and driving dragons, ascending to the Jade Emperor. The Primordial Beginning proclaims the mandate; the Most High proclaims it, only then dispatching me to transmit it.

Now I proclaim the Dao and expound the scripture for you. Responding to resonance, you see me—yet I am not present. The Dao interpenetrates without bounds. I bestow upon you the treasure chapter. The immortal register interpenetrates heaven; heaven also interpenetrates you. Responding to what is fitting, your name is raised for the future. First receive your talisman—this is the mandate’s confirmation.

Spirit talismans and spirit registers are the Gate of the Primordial Heaven’s Mandate. Spirit seals and spirit scriptures—the Three Heavens proclaim the beginning. With focused mindfulness, swallow and serve them. The Six Talismans attain perfect clarity. Wear the numinous chart. The Seven Origins universally open. The Nine Heavens command and summon; the Nine Lands memorialize names. Spirit ascends to heaven; scripture and Dao are doubly manifest.

Talismans and scriptures have distinct names; their transmission and explanation differ. Next, the *Soaring Talisman* is separately recorded. It may be transmitted to later generations’ sagely lords of the Dao. Secretly cultivate it—it is not bestowed upon the unworthy.”
